data.title: 以 3 到 5 分钟描写以下主题
data.content: University classes are now happening online, using video conferencing application, such as Zoom. There is some debate about whether or not online classes are equivalent to in-person classes. What do you think? Provide support from your personal experience and/or observation to support your opinion.
data.answer: University classes are now happening online, using video conferencing applications, such as Zoom. Although some people believe that online classes are not as effective as in-person classes, I am more inclined to believe that online classes are equivalent to in-person classes. This is because online classes can be given through clear presentation of the slides and the teacher through share screen and video function. Students can be divided into groups to engage in discussion just like in an in-person class. With functions such as vote, the teacher can gather information from the students more easily. Therefore, there are many benefits that online teaching has so it is equivalent to in-person classes.
